intro: Allantodia yuyangensis, commonly known as the Yuyang bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
